attributes.action: Save the UK FM Radio Signal
attributes.background:
In the next few years the UK’s analogue radio signal will be switched off and listeners will have to tune into digital radio instead.

The UK is NOT ready. FM sounds better and has better signal. DAB sounds tinny and car DAB signal drops out. 

PLEASE SAVE THE UK FM RADIO SIGNAL.
attributes.additional_details:
Many people will not be used to DAB systems and will already own FM capable technology and would struggle to make the change.

Older but perfectly usable stereo systems will become obsolete and people may not be able to afford new equipment.

The FM signal is a historic achievement and it works. Future generations will miss out on learning of radio frequencies.

A strong FM signal provides excellent sound quality for both music and speech, whereas DAB is significantly inferior.

attributes.action: Reduce VAT rate on fixed telephone lines and broadband
attributes.background:
Telephone lines with broadband are an essential utility for the 21st century.

Currently there is a 20% VAT levied on all services, other essential utilities are not subject to such a high rate of taxation.
attributes.additional_details:
The government is well aware of the benefits of a connected society and documents them extensively: https://www.gov.uk/government/policies/broadband-investment

Individuals and businesses benefit massively from internet and telephone connectivity and this in turn benefits our economy.

Other utilities which are essential, such as water, electricity and gas are subject to reduced rates of taxation. Telephone and broadband services should be treated the same, as an essential utility.

attributes.action: Request HM government ask the Queen to issue Royal Pardon to Edith Thompson.
attributes.background: Edith Thompson was drugged and carried unconscious to the gallows in 1923 for a crime I believe she did not commit. My grandfather DI Scholes, acquired the letters she wrote to her lover Freddie Bywaters, which 'proved' her guilt. I do not believe they proved anything. I believe Edith was innocent.
attributes.additional_details: The prosecution sought to prove 'joint enterprise.' I do not believe they did. The jury was wrongly directed by the judge. The letters never incited Freddie to murder. I have read them all. The jury was made up of 11 men and just 1 women. There was no proof that Edith knew her lover, Freddie, would stab her husband that night. An independent witness also testified that she even begged him to stop. This is a terrible miscarriage of justice that has waited 94 years to be rectified.

attributes.action: Require hoists and proper facilities to be installed in all disabled toilets
attributes.background: Whilst out I needed cleaning and changing. My nephew had to physically lift me out of my wheelchair and hold on to me to clean and change me. It was difficult and I could easily have had a fall and he could have hurt himself. All disabled toilets need a hoist and proper changing facilities.

attributes.action: Protect more of our countryside and seas by creating more conservation zones.
attributes.background: Disappearing habitat,destructive means of fishing by trawling, aquaculture in estuaries, pesticides in farming all harming our environment.

attributes.action: Stop paying wealthy pensioners the  tax-free winter fuel payment.
attributes.background: Our country needs to stop giving away  money to those who don't need it. The revenue from not paying EVERY pensioner the tax free money can better be used to help th struggling health system.

attributes.action: The Houses of Parliament should erect a monument to Daniel O'Connell
attributes.background: Daniel O'Connell, often known as The Liberator or The Great Emancipator, was an Irish political leader. He campaigned, successfully, for Catholic Emancipation in the first half of the 19th century.
attributes.additional_details: O'Connell played a leading role in achieving Catholic Emancipation - including the right for Catholics to sit in the Westminster Parliament - and the values of egalitarianism, tolerance and human rights, which he helped instil, continue to underpin modern democracy around the world. A leading MP from 1828-1841, his philosophy and career inspired diverse others from Mahatma Gandhi to Martin Luther King Jr. to Nelson Mandela. It is time for O'Connell to be recognised with a monument in Parliament.

attributes.action: Health Insurance schemes MUST include cover for counselling & Hypnotherapy
attributes.background: 1 in 4 people are affected by mental health disorders & urgently need access to affordable therapies. The NHS simply cannot cope & our mental health services are in crisis. Astonishingly, the Health Insurance Industry does not consider 'health' to include mental well being & fails to provide cover.
attributes.additional_details:
Why does the Health Insurance Industry provide cover for your body but not for your mind? 

Why can you get cover or claim money back when you see an Acupuncturist/Osteopath/Chiropractor but you can't get the same cover to see a Therapist?

Hypnotherapy is quick & effective treatment for a range of mental health issues, including; anxiety, depression, fears, phobias & addictions - ultimately helping reduce the burden on the NHS. So why is Hypnotherapy not covered under health insurance schemes?

attributes.action: The UK government should impose economic sanctions on Spain over Catalonia.
attributes.background: On 1st October 2017 the people of Catalonia voted for independence despite attempts by the central Spanish government to prevent the referendum. Scenes were shown across the media of the brutality shown towards Catalonia citizens, but the UK's response since has been shameful.
attributes.additional_details: A fundamental British value (or so we teach our children) is the importance of democracy. A right to vote and determine the future of your own people is a right protected under the European Convention on Human Rights and a pre-requisite of EU membership, not to mention the hallmark of a fair and free society. The UK government's response should recognise this by imposing sanctions against Spain or taking other diplomatic steps to secure the rights of the Catalonian people.

attributes.action: Formally support UN condemnation of the Saudi bloc's demand to close Al Jazeera.
attributes.background: A UN High Commissioner has condemned the Saudi-led bloc's demand to close Al Jazeera as an "unacceptable attack on the right to freedom of expression and opinion". The government should explicitly support the UN and oppose the Salman regime's attempt to censor TV channels available in the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
The UN High Commissioner is Zeid Ra'ad al-Hussein:
http://www.aljazeera.com/news/2017/06/high-commissioner-zeid-raad-al-hussein-call-shut-al-jazeera-unacceptable-attack-170630111642647.html

It is unacceptable to tolerate Saudi interference in what British audiences should be permitted to watch. The government should issue a formal declaration of support for the UN and unequivocally repudiate such Saudi meddling in our sources of news. It is not for the Saudis to censor our television channels.

attributes.action: Change the way in which eligibility for child benefit is calculated for couples.
attributes.background: Currently eligibility for child benefit for couples is calculated on the highest earners salary and taxable benefits.  Basically the higher earner is accountable for taxes if earning over 50k regardless of the salary of the lower earner.  For couples with one higher earner the formula is unfair.
attributes.additional_details: A couple with 2 incomes of 49k combined 98k inclusive of taxable benefits will be entitled to full child benefit and no taxation on either earner.  Where as for a couple with one higher earner for example 58k incl taxable benefits and one lower earner say 6k combined 64k.  Would still be entitled to child benefit however the higher earner would be subject to taxation.  For a family with 3 children the benefit would be 2.5k/yr with tax of 2.4k/yr.  This simply is not fair and needs reform.

attributes.action: Begin review of road traffic offences and sentencing announced in May 2014.
attributes.background: An 'urgent review' into cycling offences will not make the roads safer. It's time for the government to stop chasing  headlines and immediately move forward with the comprehensive review of all road trafiic offences and sentencing that they announced in May 2014.
attributes.additional_details:
The government has an announced an 'urgent review' into cycling offences after the death of Kim Briggs. This was a tragic but very unusual case. Of the 400 or so pedestrians killed a year in the UK, on average two are struck by cyclists. Focusing on cyclists alone will not make the roads safer. The government announced a comprehensive review of all road trafiic offences and sentencing in May 2014. It's time for it to start.

http://www.independent.co.uk/voices/charlie-alliston-cyclist-jailed-run-over-cars-vehicles-dangerous-deaths-a7959626.html

https://www.theguardian.com/environment/bike-blog/2017/sep/21/a-new-cycling-law-wont-make-roads-safer-and-could-postpone-laws-that-could

attributes.action: Raise the Help to Buy ISA qualifying limit to £300k to match Stamp Duty policy.
attributes.background: It was recently announced that Stamp Duty was abolished for first time buyers on properties up to £300,000. However, Help to Buy ISA’s only qualify for the bonus on properties up to £250,000. I feel this qualifying limit should be raised to £300,000 to be in line with the new Stamp Duty.

attributes.action: Stop involvement in the Afghan, Syrian and Iraqi Wars and bring troops home
attributes.background: Our involvement as the UK to stop the ongoing wars is the problem.  People are unhappy that we are continuously involved in the different wars and spending too much money on the wars when we could spend it on something useful in the UK. This is a major problem and could assist other campaigns
attributes.additional_details: We are spending a net amount of at least £20.3 billion just until 2010 (combined of only the cost of the afghan and Iraqi war).Many sources state that we are spending at least 37 billion by 2017 a statement by guardian stated “By 2020, Britain will have spent at least £40bn on its Afghan campaign, enough to recruit over 5,000 police officers or nurses and pay for them throughout their careers. It could fund free tuition for all students in British higher education for 10 years."

attributes.action: Ban the sale of foie gras throughout the UK when we leave the EU
attributes.background: Foie gras production has been banned in the U.K. so it seems hypocritical to still be able to sell foie gras. Now that we're leaving the EU, we should stop selling it.

attributes.action: Amend the National Lottery licence to specify the Operator should be a Charity.
attributes.background:
The UK National Lottery operator Camelot is a profit making Ltd Company which pays large dividends to Shareholders. It is NOT a registered Charity with the Charity Commission.
A requirement of the Licence should be that the operator be a registered not-for-profit Charity. The Government must act.
attributes.additional_details:
Camelot is NOT a Charity and is NOT registered with the Charity Commission. It should be a not-for-profit organisation.
Camelot's majority shareholder is a Parent Company called Premier Lotteries UK Ltd, which in turn is majority owned by a Canadian Teachers Pension Fund, specifically Ontario.
The last 2 year's dividends paid to this Canadian Pension fund (via Premier Lotteries UK Ltd) were £66.6m in 2017 and £84.2m in 2016. These are funds which could be utilised within the UK on good causes.

attributes.action: Provide victims of the most severe sexual crimes anonymity throughout trial.
attributes.background: Currently victims of crimes under the Sexual Offences (Amendment) Act 1992 are given lifetime anonymity from the media. Despite attempts to fully provide protection during trial details of the victims name are made available to the accused; even in cases of serious sexual assault by a stranger.
attributes.additional_details:
This petition calls for other means of identifying victims such as pseudonym, case number or photo to be considered.
 
Sexual assaults are crimes of power and control, a name is a key part of personal identity so giving the accused the victim’s name adds to the assault. Much of what you do or are is linked to your name, having it makes it easy to identify, locate or contact someone.
 
Using a victim’s name within courts would seem to contravene Article 8 of the Human Rights Act.

attributes.action: To have a public holiday on 21 October to be called Trafalgar Day.
attributes.background: To commemorate one of the greatest days in our history.  We should be proud of that victory in 1805.  It is long overdue.

attributes.action: Spend at least 60 billion pounds every year in Defense by 2020
attributes.background: We, as well as British and US military officials, ask that the UK government increases the armed forces defense budget so we are able to protect our country from states such as Russia and North Korea. We must stop cuts to our armed forces at this critical time, to counter the threats that face today
attributes.additional_details: https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/www.bbc.co.uk/news/amp/uk-41903960

attributes.action: Ban spice!
attributes.background: Local towns and cities are getting worse with what we call the zombie plague i.e. legal high SPICE. Businesses are losing out due to people being too scared of this epidemic, less and less people want to go into their local city or local Town! Something needs to be done about this all over the UK.

attributes.action: Relocate UK parliament and government departments somewhere outside London.
attributes.background:
The Palace of Westminster is in poor condition, requiring £4B of refurbishment work, at state expense. It's, also, regularly argued that government is too London-centric.
It's time to relocate government to a new common site, outside London, and use Westminster Palace as a commercial asset.
attributes.additional_details:
Today, Westminster Palace is a far from suitable place from where to run government and, overall, London is over-crowded, costly and detached from much of the country. Considering these points, I propose constructing a modern government campus, in a more central location, with good London transport links, perhaps, somewhere around where the M1 and west-coast main lines converge, in Northamptonshire.
The campus should include a station and accommodation for MPs staying away from home.

attributes.action: Change the law so that in court each side always pays their own legal costs
attributes.background: Going to court is hugely in favour of the party with the biggest financial clout. They can afford to risk legal costs that the smaller party can't. The smaller party has no control over the larger parties cost yet may have to pay them. There is no other business where you can't control your costs.

attributes.action: Allow Ex-Servicemen to cash in their service pensions.
attributes.background: This would give Ex-Servicement the same rights with their pension pots as similar civilian pension holders.
attributes.additional_details: This would allow the Ex-Servicemen to either buy, upscale or simply reduce their mortgages, thus providing living security. It would also provide the Ex-Servicemen with the exact same options with their pension pots as their civilian counterparts.

attributes.action: Pressure the Iraqi government to acknowledge the Kurdish referendum result.
attributes.background: On the 25th September Kurdistan (a region of Iraq) held a referendum on becoming an independent nation and autonomous state. After years of persecution, the Kurds voted for independence. Yet the Iraqi government fail to recognise the result and use troops to suppress the call for independence.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to kill llamas in slaughterhouses.
attributes.background: It is actually legal to kill and eat llama if it is killed in an approved slaughterhouse. We personally love llamas and would like to make it illegal for llamas to be killed.

attributes.action: Reform the General Election voting system -- ditch FPTP, introduce MMP (AMS).
attributes.background: FPTP is the current voting system the UK uses in its General Elections. FPTP is very 2-party orientation and is ideal in a country with no minor parties. With MMP, parliament can be much more representative of what UK citizens actually want and not restricted to tactical voting.
attributes.additional_details:
In the second most recent, the 2015 General Election, Conservatives received 36.9% of the popular vote, however, received 51% of the seats in parliament (which translates to 100% of the power as they received a majority).
Although receiving a majority in parliament, the Conservatives did not receive a majority of UK citizens wanting them in power.
An even more extreme example, UKIP, who received 12.6% of the popular vote, only received one seat (0.15% of the total seats) in parliament. (Source: http://www.ukpolitical.info/2015.htm)

attributes.action: Call an immediate election if anything in a manifesto is not actioned as stated
attributes.background: Any amendment to a manifesto in government creates an issue of trust. If a government makes pledges that are unrealistic or exaggerated they should be held to account. Pledges should be time specific. An independent panel of judges will rule, and ask parliament to hold an election as appropriate

attributes.action:
Award H/B so rents paid in full to parents/sons/daughters over 18
M/Severe ASD
attributes.background: No discrimination in H/Benefit.Rent for parents with children over 18 who have moderate to severe Autism Spectrum disorder should be paid in full as thousands of parents cannot work and are stuck on benefits due to lack of support as their young adult doesn't have the capacity to live independently.
attributes.additional_details:
My son is now 20 years old and does not have full coherency. I have singular guardianship. He receives very little support and I receive the same 10 hrs. At the last meeting social services wanted to 
drop those hours by a further 4. I cannot work because I am my sons 
full time carer, meaning I am forced to remain on benefits. I have rent & bills to pay not to mention ensuring that their are hearty meals on the table for a growing lad. My housing benefit doesn't cut it do S/Fall's still £374 pm

attributes.action: Schools to have paediatric adrenaline auto-injectors for children in anaphylaxis
attributes.background: Schools have an increasing number of children with severe allergies. There have been at least 2 cases recently of a child dying from anaphylaxis at school. Each school having their own adrenaline auto injectors could contribute to saving a child’s life when they are having an anaphylactic event.
attributes.additional_details: Each school would need 2 paediatric auto injectors which would be kept in an area accessible and known to all staff. Staff would also check the product is in date.

attributes.action: Get Government to give social services more money
attributes.background: I got brought into foster care in 2008 and throughout the years I have seen how the lack of funding has affected how these services have worked. Social workers are given over 30 young people to look after when the most they should have is 16.Lack of funds means they can't give the service they want.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.theguardian.com/business/2017/sep/26/cuts-to-social-services-and-increased-tax-revenue-deliver-reduced-budget-defcit
We need more social workers yet they can't be hired because there isn't enough funding. The funding for social services has slowly been decreased until they're almost at breaking point now. Social workers are forced to leave vulnerable young people with carers without being introduced. Its harmful to the children and the parents and is causing emotional distress.

attributes.action: Improve the Ely junction asap! And the east Anglia rail network in general.
attributes.background: The Ely junction needs to be upgraded. And some people in government reconise this. However this project is still being kicked down the road. This needed to happen years ago. No more delays or excuses. Let's pressure the government into speeding the process up now!

attributes.action: Abusive partners should lose the privilege to have contact with their child(ren)
attributes.background: Abusive partners should lose the privilege to have contact with their child(ren) if the mother is forced to flee domestic abuse whilst she is pregnant or whilst the child is too young to choose for themselves.
attributes.additional_details: Abusive ex partners also use children as a gateway back into their victims life. Safeguarding restrictions being put in place is not sufficient. If the child has contact with the abusive parent, they are very likely to be exposed to domestic abuse when observing the parent in future relationships. This can be damaging and is not in a child's best interest. The abuser may also abuse the child or use the child to indirectly continue to abuse their ex partner.

attributes.action: Raise basic salaries for 999 emergency call handlers
attributes.background: After watching a TV documentary series, the extremely difficult, high pressure and increasingly busy environment that 999 emergency call handlers experience, it seems unfair that their basic salaries are relatively low.
attributes.additional_details:
£15,000-£26,000 is apparently the salary expected for this role

https://nationalcareersservice.direct.gov.uk/job-profiles/emergency-medical-dispatcher

Although the entire NHS is financially stretched, and all NHS staff should ideally be paid more than they are currently, it is clear to see from watching this documentary, that the extreme pressures that these call handlers work under should be rewarded with a higher basic salary for the amazing work they do!

attributes.action: No cash transaction after 2025-30
attributes.background:
It would eliminate “black markets” and allow easier monetary policy.
Underground economy in the UK is worth +/- £150bn a year.
It could easily solve problems with the NHS, social housing, investment in research, education etc.
attributes.additional_details:
It would help to “wipe off “ undeclared work and organised crime income.
Cash transactions are less popular each year.
Let’s make the UK a leader and be the first Cashless Nation.

attributes.action: Amend the Dangerous Wild Animals Act to Exotic and Dangerous Wild Animals Act
attributes.background: Amend the DWA, making it a legal obligation to possess a license for ownership of any wild or non-native species; preventing whimsical buying of animals with specialist care needs to safeguard animal welfare.
attributes.additional_details: Buying without researching care needs of specific animals is especially damaging to reptiles which suffer from ailments, like metabolic bone disease, as a result of improper husbandry. Introducing a license for exotic pet ownership should encourage people buying to understand the commitment they are undertaking, particularly if paired with expert consultation at the time of license purchase. The "EDWA" should also aim to hold accountable those involved in crimes against the Animal Welfare Act.

attributes.action: Amend the new SDLT rules to include new & existing shared ownership home owners
attributes.background: The new SDLT rules announced in the budget allows first time buyers to avoid stamp duty for properties up to £300k. Shared ownership home owners are not due to pay stamp duty until they staircase to above 80% ownership however they are still liable to pay despite it being their first purchase.
attributes.additional_details: Shared ownership home owners can defer the stamp duty payment until over 80% of a property is owned.  Shared ownership is a scheme used by many young adults to try and get onto the property ladder as a first time buyer. Stamp duty should not be payable for those who are shared ownership home owners on their purchase including when they staircase so are in a position where is needs to be paid for the first time. The new rules need to be amended to cover people in this situation.

attributes.action: Make the Monday after Remembrance Sunday a bank holiday.
attributes.background: A lot of people like to travel to the Remembrance Sunday parades. Many of these people are ex-service personnel now working for civilian companies, having the Monday off would allow them to travel to London for example or where they spent much of their service life such as Portsmouth & Plymouth
attributes.additional_details: for the Navy and Aldershot for the Army. They would be able to travel with their families and meet with old comrades and the people who are serving now so they can share memories and stories of old friends who are no longer with us and the places they have been and things they have seen.

attributes.action: Prevent the DVLA from selling personal information to outside companies
attributes.background: It has come to light that the DVLA are selling personal information to parking companies for the purpose of pursuing individuals in respect of alleged parking offences

attributes.action: Make getting a tattoo legal at 16 legal with parental consent.
attributes.background: Waiting to be 18 to get a tattoo can be a long, hard wait but sometimes, not everyone can reach it. It's devastating. If getting a tattoo at 16 becomes legal with the parent's consent then people can get something symbolic before they go. This, I hope is something that many others will agree on.

attributes.action: Stop penalising long-term partners at 40% when it comes to Inheritance Tax
attributes.background: We believe, in terms of Inheritance Tax, long-term partners are being treated grossly unfairly as opposed to married couples/civil partners.  Like millions of others in this country, long-term partners are equally committed to each other as anyone else and should not be penalised with a 40% tax!
attributes.additional_details: Some12,000,000 people in this country for many personal reasons choose not to marry.  In some cases a previous bad experience in marriage may persuade them not to say "I do" for a second time. Previous correspondence from the Treasury suggested that married couples/civil partners were seen as being in "committed/recognised" relationships.  This is something of an insult to genuine couples who have been together but unmarried for 25+ years. The government must stop this totally unfair prejudice.

attributes.action: Change how pets are seen in law to ensure police/CPS can prosecute
attributes.background: When clear intent is shown to deprive a family or persons of their pet the police should have the framework in place to ensure the CPS can make an informed decision on prosecution, the Theft Act 1968 doesn't outline what is seen as acceptable steps to reunite an owner with their pet.
attributes.additional_details:
We've seen a sharp rise in pet thefts and millions of Britons will agree, pets are more than just property, they are family. 

We the undersigned request that this government takes further steps to protect animals and owners by clearly outlining:

1) What is seen as acceptable steps to reunite owners with their pets. 

We strongly urge the requirement for chips to be checked as soon as an animal is discovered. This step will allow the police to have a clear view of what is seen as acceptable so "intent to deprive" can be formed. 

2) Reconsider the use the term of "property" for pets. 

Legislation regarding animal welfare shows that we do see them as more than possessions.

attributes.action: Every person in the UK to be given a tree to plant to reverse UK deforestation
attributes.background: The UK is believed to be in deforestation (cut down more trees than are planted). This is on top of the UK tree land mass (13%) is far behind other countries, EU (38%), Japan (68%), USA (34%). If every person in the UK were given a tree to plant the UK tree population could dramatically increase

attributes.action: Make it illegal for coaches to transport children with inadequate seatbelts
attributes.background: In 2016 4% of road deaths were children (a). The law states very clearly that "you can be fined up to £500 if a child isn’t in the correct seat while you’re driving" (b).  Yet currently minibuses and coaches are exempt; "the law does not require passengers under 14 years old to wear a seat belt" (c)
attributes.additional_details:
(a) https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/648081/rrcgb2016-01.pdf

(b) https://www.gov.uk/seat-belts-law 

(c) http://www.childcarseats.org.uk/the-law/other-vehicles-buses-coaches-and-minibuses/

attributes.action: Ban use of Automatic Number Plate Recognition unless investigating crime
attributes.background: Since ANPR is by definition, a tool of mass surveillance, requiring no 'probable cause' to investigate the whereabouts of law-abiding citizens, it has no place in a free society.
attributes.additional_details: For the reasons mentioned above, I consider the use of ANPR, for anything other than the investigation of crime, to be an illegal act. It is incompatible with the principles of 'innocent until proven guilty', which has been a cornerstone of British justice for centuries. ANPR has been installed as a 'fait accompli', enabling routine and blanket mass surveillance of the British population. Simply put, unless I am a criminal suspect, it is none of the government's business where I go in my car.

attributes.action: Government to help Monarch (now in administration)
attributes.background: If the Government could step in and either loan it money or buy it and have Monarch run as a State entity, it could prevent so many job losses and retain happy customers, as well as having an asset.
attributes.additional_details: Monarch had many bookings and customers at the time of its collapse. It has a strong and loyal staff base. This airline can be saved for the good of all.

attributes.action: Create a Government of Shared Unity
attributes.background: Whereby the position of Prime minister is replaced by a parliamentary body consisting of representatives from each party which gained a significant number of votes in the election.
attributes.additional_details: Democracy voted that not one single party should lead Government. To solve issues, and to conclude  Brexit well, Great Britain needs a group of people standing for the best principles from major parties. The needs of Great Britain are large and complex, and can not be resolved by the ideas of one single party. We do not need a dictator; we need a group of passionate people who want to resolve the problems of Great Britain from every aspect-the environment; financially; socially... the list goes on.

attributes.action: Prevent the current changes to pharmacy regulations being debated by the DoH
attributes.background: The planned changes to pharmacy regulations aim to allow a pharmacy to open and allow prescription-only medicines to be given out without a Responsible Pharmacist present. This will inevitably result in both patient harm and reduced access to pharmacy services for patients.
attributes.additional_details: The government has said that they wish to "better utilise the skills of pharmacists in healthcare settings such as hospitals and GP practices", but have put no proposals forward to guarantee jobs for the many community pharmacists and Locums that this will put out of work. People who have been at the heart of the community helping patients will now find themselves without work, and those patients will find they have reduced access to pharmacy services.

attributes.action: Call on DEFRA to withdraw UK approval of A24 trap, sold in NZ to kill hedgehogs.
attributes.background: DEFRA recently approved the use of these traps in England (pending in Wales & Scotland). The traps(https://www.goodnature.co.nz/pests/#c315) are sold to kill hedgehogs (& other species), in New Zealand where hedgehogs are non-native & considered a ‘pest’ species.
attributes.additional_details: In the UK hedgehogs are protected being listed on Schedule 6 of the Wildlife & Countryside Act. If a trap is set & it catches a hedgehog, then the person who set the trap can be prosecuted. Anyone setting traps for ‘vermin’ or non-protected species is obliged to take all reasonable precautions to avoid catching a protected species, since there are no ‘reasonable precautions’ to avoid catching hedgehogs using this trap, anyone who sets them is at risk of prosecution if they catch a hedgehog.

attributes.action: Let the people decide whether Brexit included the single market & customs union
attributes.background: This petition requires the UK Governemnt to clarify by public vote before March 2018 whether the intention of referendum voters was to leave membership of the EU only, or also to leave the single market and customs union and related institutions as extrapolated by the UK Government.

attributes.action: Petition for annual increase for pensioners outside the EU Block.
attributes.background: My pension has been deferred for 5 years, by various Governments and now I find, I will not get yearly pension rises, because I am not in an EU country!
